info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:11PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A BAND OF BRIEF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN HAMPSHIRE... NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND NORTHWESTERN HAMPDEN COUNTIES... At 1108 PM EDT, a band of brief heavy snow along with strong gusty west winds up to 45 mph, was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Readsboro to Milton. Movement was east at 50 mph. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Monroe, Montague, Northfield, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Chester, Charlemont, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington and Leyden. The snow will result in brief reduced visbility and may result in snow covered roads, especially across the higher elevations. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.
